SEARCH
Package gw.api.database

Class Query<T extends Bean>

java.lang.Object
gw.api.database.Query<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.guidewire.pl.system.database.query2.impl.IQueryBuilderInternal<T>, com.guidewire.pl.system.database.query2.impl.ISimpleQueryBuilderInternal<T>, IQuery<T>, IQueryBuilder<T>, ISelectQueryBuilder<T>, ISimpleQueryBuilder<T>
public class Query<T extends Bean> extends Object implements ISelectQueryBuilder<T>, com.guidewire.pl.system.database.query2.impl.IQueryBuilderInternal<T>
Used to create a new query to the database. The provided bean type is used as the result type.
Author:
dbrewster

    • isLogSQL

      public boolean isLogSQL()
      Specified by:
      isLogSQL in interface IQuery<T extends Bean>
      Returns:
      true if the sql for this query will be logged, false if not. The query is logged to the PLLoggerCategory.SERVER_DATABASE log category at the info level

    • withLogSQL

      public Query<T> withLogSQL(boolean logSQL)
      Turns on or off SQL logging. The query is logged to the PLLoggerCategory.SERVER_DATABASE log category at the info level
      Specified by:
      withLogSQL in interface IQuery<T extends Bean>
      Parameters:
      logSQL - true to log SQL, false to not
      Returns:
      the this ptr

    • forceEmpty

      public Query<T> forceEmpty()
      When calling select() or getProcessor() on this query, returns a processor that returns no results. Use with care.

      NOTE: The query will be executed if used as a sub-query.

      Example usages: 1. we don't want to return any results for security reasons 2. we want to short-circuit when we know the query will return no results such as when comparing whether a non-nullable column has a null value.

      Specified by:
      forceEmpty in interface ISelectQueryBuilder<T extends Bean>
      Returns:
      the this ptr

    • getRawQuery

      public com.guidewire.pl.system.database.impl.QueryImpl<T> getRawQuery()
      Deprecated.
      Do not use. The underlying query implementation object has methods that will not work when used in conjunction with this interface. This is only provided for backward-compatibility with older APIs that require instances of Query.
      Gets the underlying query implementation object.
      Specified by:
      getRawQuery in interface IQuery<T extends Bean>

    • union

      public GroupingQuery<T> union(IQuery<T> unionQuery)
      Unions this query with the query passed in. The return type of the two queries must be equal. The result query will not contain duplicate queries from the two sets. Union can only be done once on a query. Basically this method builds a binary tree and the result of this method is the union of this query and unionQuery.
      Specified by:
      union in interface IQuery<T extends Bean>
      Parameters:
      unionQuery - the query to union with
      Returns:
      the result query that is the union of this and the query passed in.

    • compareIgnoreCase

      public Restriction<T> compareIgnoreCase(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, Relop op, Object value)
      Compares a character-based column against a character-based value given an operation type.

      String comparisons will be case-insensitive and as configured for linguistic search. Can cause poor performance with columns not marked as supportsLinguisticSearch and without an indexed denorm column.

      Specified by:
      compareIgnoreCase in interface ISimpleQueryBuilder<T extends Bean>
      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare
      op - The operation
      value - The value
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • between

      public Restriction<T> between(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, Object startValue, Object endValue)
      Compares a column against two values using a between clause. This will throw an exception if either startValue or endValue, or both are null.

      Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted

      A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.

      Specified by:
      between in interface ISimpleQueryBuilder<T extends Bean>
      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare
      startValue - The start value of the between
      endValue - The end value of the between
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • subselect

      public Table<T> subselect(IEntityPropertyInfo columnInThisTable, InOperation op, IEntityPropertyInfo columnInJoinTable, SubselectOption... options)
      Joins a table with this table using a sub-select clause.

      Two columns are required, a column in the current table and a column in the join table.

      If the operation is CompareIn, include rows that have a match in the correlated sub-query; if the operation is CompareNotIn, exclude rows that have a match in the correlated sub-query.

      Specified by:
      subselect in interface ISimpleQueryBuilder<T extends Bean>
      Parameters:
      columnInThisTable - the column in the current table to compare against
      op - the in clause operation
      columnInJoinTable - the column in the joining table
      options - options for constructing the subselect
      Returns:
      the Table being joined to

    • subselect

      public Table<T> subselect(DBFunction columnInThisTable, InOperation op, IEntityPropertyInfo columnInJoinTable, SubselectOption... options)
      Joins a table with this table using a sub-select clause.

      Two columns are required, a column in the current table and a column in the join table.

      If the operation is CompareIn, include rows that have a match in the correlated sub-query; if the operation is CompareNotIn, exclude rows that have a match in the correlated sub-query.

      Specified by:
      subselect in interface ISimpleQueryBuilder<T extends Bean>
      Parameters:
      columnInThisTable - a column in the current table
      op - the in clause operation
      columnInJoinTable - the column in the joining table
      options - options for constructing the subselect
      Returns:
      the Table being joined to

    • subselect

      public Table<T> subselect(DBFunction columnInThisTable, InOperation op, DBFunction columnInJoinTable, SubselectOption... options)
      Joins a table with this table using a sub-select clause.

      Two columns are required, a column in the current table and a column in the join table.

      If the operation is CompareIn, include rows that have a match in the correlated sub-query; if the operation is CompareNotIn, exclude rows that have a match in the correlated sub-query.

      Specified by:
      subselect in interface ISimpleQueryBuilder<T extends Bean>
      Parameters:
      columnInThisTable - a column in the current table
      op - the in clause operation
      columnInJoinTable - the column in the joining table
      options - options for constructing the subselect
      Returns:
      the Table being joined to

    • subselect

      public Table<T> subselect(IEntityPropertyInfo columnInThisTable, InOperation op, IQuery queryToJoinTo, IEntityPropertyInfo columnInQuery, SubselectOption... options)
      Joins a column from table with a column from another query.

      If the operation is CompareIn, include rows that have a match in the correlated sub-query; if the operation is CompareNotIn, exclude rows that have a match in the correlated sub-query.

      Specified by:
      subselect in interface ISimpleQueryBuilder<T extends Bean>
      Parameters:
      columnInThisTable - the column in the current table to compare against
      op - the in clause operation
      queryToJoinTo - the joining query
      columnInQuery - the joining column in the query
      options - options for constructing the subselect
      Returns:
      the Table being joined to

    • and

      public Restriction<T> and(BooleanExpression<T> exp)
      Creates a new "and" expression on this restriction.

      All operations on the expression will operate in terms of the condition this expression was passed in to. For example:

      xxx.and(new BooleanExpression<T>() { public void execute(Restriction<T> restriction) { restriction.compare("A", Equals, 10); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 20); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 30); } });

      Will find all things that have (A=10 and A=20 and A=30)

      Specified by:
      and in interface ISimpleQueryBuilder<T extends Bean>
      Parameters:
      exp - a block that adds predicates to the expression tree
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • or

      public Restriction<T> or(BooleanExpression<T> exp)
      Creates a new "or" expression on this restriction.

      All operations on the expression will operate in terms of the condition this expression was passed in to. For example:

      xxx.or(new BooleanExpression<T>() { public void execute(Restriction<T> restriction) { restriction.compare("A", Equals, 10); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 20); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 30); } });

      Will find all things that have (A=10 or A=20 or A=30)

      Specified by:
      or in interface ISimpleQueryBuilder<T extends Bean>
      Parameters:
      exp - a block that adds predicates to the expression tree
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • join

      public Table<T> join(ILinkPropertyInfo column)
      Used to join this table to another table via a foreign key. If the FK property is on this table, this method will join from this table to another. If the two tables have already been joined, when the SQL is generated, the two tables will be joined only once and the restrictions will be combined. If the FK property is on another table, this method will join from the remote table to this table. If the two tables have already been joined, when the SQL is generated, there will be as many joins as the number of times that this method has been invoked. The FK will be joined with the ID of the corresponding table Adding additional columns will cause the join to be specified as a select. The additional columns can contain SQL functions allowing you to do an implicit group by on the remaining columns
      Specified by:
      join in interface IQueryBuilder<T extends Bean>
      Parameters:
      column - the FK to join through
      Returns:
      the table being joined to, i.e., the table referred to by column.

    • joinAgain

      @Deprecated public Table<T> joinAgain(ILinkPropertyInfo column)
      Deprecated.
      This method will be removed in a future release. Do not use. Internal code should use IQueryBuilderInternal.joinAgain(gw.entity.ILinkPropertyInfo) instead.
      Used to join this table to another table via a foreign key. If this table has already been joined to the other table, when the SQL is generated, the two tables will be joined only once and the restrictions will be combined. This method will join from this table to another if the FK property is on this table. This method will join from the remote table to this table if the FK property is on another table The FK will be joined with the ID of the corresponding table Adding additional columns will cause the join to be specified as a select. The additional columns can contain SQL functions allowing you to do an implicit group by on the remaining columns
      Specified by:
      joinAgain in interface IQueryBuilder<T extends Bean>
      Specified by:
      joinAgain in interface com.guidewire.pl.system.database.query2.impl.IQueryBuilderInternal<T extends Bean>
      Parameters:
      column - the FK to join through
      Returns:
      the table being joined to, i.e., the table referred to by column.

      @Deprecated public Table<T> join(IEntityPropertyInfo columnInThisTable, IEntityPropertyInfo columnInOtherTable)
      Deprecated.
      This method will be removed in a future release. Do not use. Internal code should use IQueryBuilder.join(gw.entity.IEntityPropertyInfo, gw.entity.IEntityPropertyInfo) instead.
      Used to join this table to another table via an arbitrary pair of columns. Adding additional columns will cause the join to be specified as a select. The additional columns can contain SQL functions allowing you to do an implicit group by on the remaining columns.
      Specified by:
      join in interface IQueryBuilder<T extends Bean>
      Parameters:
      columnInThisTable - column in this table
      columnInOtherTable - column in table being joined to
      Returns:
      the table being joined to, i.e., the table which "owns" columnInOtherTable.

This method will join from the remote table to this table if the FK property is on another table The FK will be joined with the ID of the corresponding table Adding additional columns will cause the join to be specified as a select. The additional columns can contain SQL functions allowing you to do an implicit group by on the remaining columns

    • withinDistance

      public Restriction<T> withinDistance(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, SpatialPoint center, Number distance, UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance)
      Searches for points that are 'distance' units from center. The query result is sorted by distance from center in ascending order. Other order by columns may be specified, however distance is always implicitly the first expression in the sort.
      Specified by:
      withinDistance in interface ISimpleQueryBuilder<T extends Bean>
      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare. Must be a column of type spatialpoint.
      center - The center of the search
      distance -
      unitOfDistance - The unit of distance @return this. Used for the builder pattern

      Searches for polygons that contain or do not contain the given point. Points on the boundary of the polygon are considered within. Note that this method is overloaded to allow searching of either points in a given polygon or polygons that contain a given point.

      Parameters:

      point - the point to use for the search

      this. Used for the builder pattern
